commentary: Rabada to Sharma, OUT taken by Rabada? He certainly thinks so. For a fast bowler, that's a terrific effort. There is some extra bounce in this surface, so the ball pops up and hits Rohit's splice, the ball is hit back to Rabada because Rohit chose a full face, as opposed to a flick or a slightly open-faced drive. Rabada keeps his eyes on it, gets low and takes a clean catch inches away from the ground. Got his fingers underneath the ball. Miller's quick through the sweep, because he has been forced to be quick through his sweeps because of Chahal's quicker pace. The ball drifts, dips and beats the wild slog. But has he overstepped?
